âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Short, fun, clear and concise. Seems perfect for CoC, nice puzzle!

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I did it in less than 3min. It is a nice CoC.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I enjoyed this puzzle. The difficulty is perfect for CoC.
I really enjoyed your puzzle ! Simple but fun !

Input
* Please split Line 1 and Line 2 into separate lines.

* Please format the line numbers in <<bold>>.

Constraints
* Please ensure that each constraint appears on its own separate line.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. write answer.

Cases
* These cases are the same:
  â€¢ Test 2
  â€¢ Validator 2
  Please revise them so that they are similar but different.

* Please revise the tests so that all starting letters from a to z are covered.

* Please revise the validators so that all starting letters from a to z are covered.

Thanks.

Hi! I wanted to send a sincere thank you for your feedback. Since this is my first time contributing to the community, I know I still have a lot to learn and it was hard to avoid making some beginner mistakes. Your guidance was incredibly helpful in showing me the right way to do things.

Following your advice, Iâ€™ve refined the contribution by splitting the input into separate lines, bolding the line numbers with <<Bold>>, and placing each constraint on its own line. I also updated the stub generator with the write answer statement and expanded both the tests and validators to cover the entire alphabet from A to Z. Thank you for helping me grow as a contributor!

Glad to help ðŸ™‚

There are two additional changes to make:

Input / Output
* Please format the word "Line" in <<bold>> as well, consistent with how it was previously done correctly in the Output section.

Cases
* Without modifying the existing cases, please add Test 5 and Validator 5, ensuring that all of the following conditions are met:

  â€¢ N = 20.

  â€¢ The starting letters are in random order (i.e. not alphabetical).

  â€¢ Some of the starting letters are identical (some consecutive and some not consecutive).

  â€¢ The expected outputs of Test 5 and Validator 5 are not the same.

* Also note that all tests and their corresponding validators currently expect the same output. While this isn't ideal, we can leave them unchanged this time since the inputs differ and ensure complete coverage of the alphabet.

Thanks.

Thank you so much for your patience and the feedback!

Since this is my very first contribution, Iâ€™ve realized there is a lot to learn, and Iâ€™m really grateful for the opportunity to learn from my initial mistakes.

I have updated the contribution based on your suggestions. Could you please take another look and let me know if there are still any other areas that need adjustment?

Thanks again for guiding me through this!

No worries.

The only issue now is that the new cases contain the input word of "x-ray", which contains a non-letter character.
